document_about.summary: An induction (onboarding) slide deck for new members of Tatweer Education Holding (Tatweer Holding Company). It introduces Tatweer, its leadership and structure, and provides new-hire policies (dress code, attendance/leaves, benefits, performance cycle, learning & development, cybersecurity awareness, buddy program), plus internal tools and employee services (ERP/HR system, internal portal, fingerprint registration, Wala Plus discounts, shuttle and Uber business transport).

cybersecurity_awareness.purpose: Raise awareness among new employees about key practices to protect the digital work environment.
passwords: Never share your passwords with anyone.
Change your password regularly, at least every 90 days.
email_practices: Avoid opening links or attachments from unknown sources.
Do not send sensitive information via email without encryption.
device_usage: Do not use organizational devices for personal purposes.
Do not install any software without IT department approval.
Immediately report if a device is lost or suspected to be compromised.
data_and_information: Store important files in designated and approved locations.
Do not use unapproved USB storage devices.
incident_reporting: Report any suspicious message or behavior immediately to the cybersecurity team.
Do not ignore security alerts or protection messages.
employee_commitment: Employees are responsible for protecting the information they handle.
Following security instructions protects both the organization and the employee from cyber threats.

assigned_buddy_program.objective: Ensure new hires have a smooth transition and feel supported during onboarding by providing a knowledgeable and approachable buddy.
buddy_role: First point of contact for new hire questions or guidance.
Help new hire understand company culture, policies, and work environment.
Introduce new employees to team members and key stakeholders.
Support navigation of internal systems, tools, and resources.
Encourage engagement and participation in activities and meetings.
Share tips and best practices related to day-to-day work.

pre_joining: Coordinate with HR to understand start date and basic details (buddy is copied in the onboarding email).
Prepare a welcome plan (e.g., coffee chats, first-day lunch if possible).
first_week: Meet with the new hire and offer a workplace tour.
Help set up basic tools (emails, systems access) and guide through onboarding tasks.
Introduce the new hire to team members and key departments.
first_month: Schedule regular informal check-ins (e.g., weekly coffee chats or brief catch-ups).
Be available to answer questions, clarify expectations, and assist with challenges.
Provide insights into department practices and performance expectations.
after_first_month: Continue to offer support and guidance as needed.
Encourage the new hire’s independence while remaining approachable.
Share feedback with HR if any concerns or suggestions arise.

Cybersecurity Awareness
Cybersecurity is a fundamental element in safeguarding the organization's information and systems. This 
document aims to raise awareness among new employees about the key practices they should follow to protect 
the digital work environment.
Passwords
• Use strong and unique passwords.
• Never share your passwords with anyone.
• Change your password regularly, at least every 90 days.
Email
• Avoid opening links or attachments from unknown sources.
• Verify the sender's email address.
• Do not send sensitive information via email without encryption.
Device Usage
• Do not use organizational devices for personal purposes.
• Do not install any software without IT department approval.
• Immediately report if a device is lost or suspected to be 
compromised.

• Treat all information as confidential.
• Store important files in designated and approved locations.
• Do not use unapproved USB storage devices.
Data & Information
Incident Reporting
• Report any suspicious message or behavior immediately to the cybersecurity 
team.
• Send reports to the following email: [TatweerSecurity@tatweer.sa](mailto:TatweerSecurity@tatweer.sa)
• Do not ignore security alerts or protection messages.
Employee Commitment
• Employees are responsible for protecting the information they 
handle.
• Following security instructions protects both the organization and 
the employee from cyber threats.
